architectural_decisions.title: Use Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure a scalable, maintainable, and secure system.

architectural_decisions.title: Implement Repository Pattern
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract the data access layer and provide methods for CRUD operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Utilize Dependency Injection
architectural_decisions.rationale: To manage dependencies, such as the current user and the payment processor.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling
architectural_decisions.rationale: To handle various error scenarios, such as invalid tokens, unauthorized access, and failed payments.

architectural_decisions.title: Support Multiple Payment Providers
architectural_decisions.rationale: To offer flexibility and choice in payment options for customers.

architectural_decisions.title: Enforce Authorization at Various Endpoints
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure that users can only access or modify resources they have permission to.

architectural_decisions.title: Employ ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To simplify database operations and improve code readability.

architectural_decisions.title: Send Order Confirmation Emails
architectural_decisions.rationale: To notify customers about newly placed orders.

components.name: orders
components.description: REST API endpoints for order management

components.name: processor
components.description: Handles payment processing for the e-commerce API

Create a New Order.description: This endpoint allows users to create a new order by providing order items, shipping address, and payment method.

steps.description: Send a POST request to /api/orders/create with the request body containing order items, shipping address, and payment method.
Verify the response contains the order_id, status, total, items, and created_at fields indicating successful creation.

Get Order Details.description: This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific order by its ID.

steps.description: Send a GET request to /api/orders/{order_id}, where {order_id} is the unique identifier of the order.
Verify the response contains the order_id, status, total, items, and created_at fields indicating successful retrieval.

List User Orders.description: This endpoint lists all orders for the current user, supporting pagination via limit and offset parameters.

steps.description: Send a GET request to /api/orders/, optionally including query parameters limit and offset to control pagination.
Verify the response contains an array of objects with order_id, status, total, items, and created_at fields indicating successful listing.

Cancel an Order.description: This endpoint allows users to cancel a pending order.

steps.description: Send a POST request to /api/orders/{order_id}/cancel, where {order_id} is the unique identifier of the order.
Verify the response message indicates successful cancellation of the order.
